name: 360giving-blagrave-trust-2016
title: 360Giving data: Grants awarded by the Blagrave Trust in 2016
description: This is an example data package showcasing how grants data for a particular funder and a particular year could be packaged using data packages profiles

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The unique identifier for this grant. Made up of your 360Giving prefix, and an identifier from your records. See the '360Giving Grant identifier guidance' for details.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: A title for this grant activity. This should be under 140 characters long.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A short description of this grant activity.

fields.name: Currency
fields.description: The currency used in amounts. Use the three-letter currency code from ISO 4217. eg: Use GBP for Pounds Sterling.

fields.name: Amount Awarded
fields.description: Total amount awarded in numbers (do not include commas or currency symbols such as £). If you have provided detailed transaction information on a separate table, this should equal the sum of all the award transactions for this grant.

fields.name: Amount Disbursed
fields.description: Total amount disbursed (paid) to this grantee when this record was last updated (in numbers: do not include commas or currency symbols such as £)). If you have provided detailed transaction information on a separate table, this should equal the sum of all the disbursement transactions for this grant.

fields.name: Award Date
fields.description: When was the decision to award this grant made. Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format.

fields.name: URL
fields.description: A URL (Web Address) where further information about this grant can be found. This could point to the website of the recipient organisation, or might link to further details on the funders website.

fields.name: Planned Dates:Start Date
fields.description: All events should have a start date. Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format. If the month or day are not available, these may be omitted.

fields.name: Planned Dates:End Date
fields.description: Events or activities lasting more than one day should have either a duration (in months) or an end date. Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format. If the month or day are not available, these may be omitted.

fields.name: Planned Dates:Duration (months)
fields.description: Events or activities lasting more than one day should have either a duration (in months) or an end date.

fields.name: Recipient Org:Identifier
fields.description: A globally unique identifier for this organisation. This is important to enable data on funders and recipients to be linked up across different grant-makers. The 'Organisation Identifier Standard' guidance explains how to create this ID, based either on the known company or charity number, or upon identifiers held in the grant-maker's internal systems.

fields.name: Recipient Org:Name
fields.description: Organisation name

fields.name: Recipient Org:Charity Number
fields.description: Registered charity number, if applicable.

fields.name: Recipient Org:Company Number
fields.description: Registered UK company number, if applicable.

fields.name: Recipient Org:Street Address
fields.description: Building number and street name.

fields.name: Recipient Org:City
fields.description: City or town.

fields.name: Recipient Org:County
fields.description: County

fields.name: Recipient Org:Country
fields.description: Country

fields.name: Recipient Org:Postal Code
fields.description: Postal code (please try and provide a post code whenever possible)

fields.name: Recipient Org:Description
fields.description: A short description of this organisation and its area of work

fields.name: Recipient Org:Web Address
fields.description: A web address for the Organisation

fields.name: Beneficiary Location:Name
fields.description: A name for this location.

fields.name: Beneficiary Location:Country Code
fields.description: The ISO Country Code of the location of this activity.

fields.name: Beneficiary Location:Latitude
fields.description: The latitude of a point location

fields.name: Beneficiary Location:Longitude
fields.description: The longitude of a point location

fields.name: Beneficiary Location:Geographic Code
fields.description: A code referring to a geographical area, drawn from an established gazetteer. For example, the code for a local authority ward, or parliamentary constituency.

fields.name: Beneficiary Location:Geographic Code Type
fields.description: The type of Geographic Code (geoCode) used (e.g. Ward, Parliamentary Constituency etc.). This value for this field should be drawn from the codelist of geographic code types.

fields.name: Funding Org:Identifier
fields.description: A globally unique identifier for this organisation. This is important to enable data on funders and recipients to be linked up across different grant-makers. The 'Organisation Identifier Standard 'guidance explains how to create this ID, based either on the known company or charity number, or upon identifiers held in the grant-maker's internal systems.

fields.name: Funding Org:Name
fields.description: Organisation name

fields.name: Funding Org:Department
fields.description: The department or sub-unit of this organisation making or receiving the grant.

fields.name: Grant Programme:Code
fields.description: An identifier for this grant programme.

fields.name: Grant Programme:Title
fields.description: The title of this grant programme.

fields.name: Grant Programme:URL
fields.description: A web link to more details of this grant programme.

fields.name: From an open call?
fields.description: Was this grant made as the result of an open call for applications? Values should be 'Yes' or 'No'

fields.name: Related Activity
fields.description: The identifiers of any related activities (e.g. other grants given as part of a multi-grant project).

fields.name: Last modified
fields.description: The date and time when information about this grant was last updated.

fields.name: Data Source
fields.description: A web link pointing to the source of this data. This may be an original 360Giving data file, a file from which the data was converted, or an organisation website.
